content: very basic ear-flap hat in bulky weight yarn by anne carroll gilmour 5 sizes in 3 5 stitch per inch/2 5 cm gauge see gauge tricks on last page for other sizing options shown on liam who is 19 months old head size almost 20 inches/51cm materials about 80 84 88 92 yds of a bulky weight yarn shown in noro kureyon 16 /41cm circular ndl and 7-8 /20cm dp ndls in size #10 us/ #6 metric or size required to give a gauge of 3 5 sts and 5 rnds per inch/2 5cm one crochet hook size h/5 and a large eye yarn darner for finishing optional one 5/8 or 1 5cm wooden bead with ¼ /1cm hole for adjustment slider on hat ties 8 7 7 8 7 stitch markers this hat is worked bottom to top begun by working the 2 earflaps separately back and forth on 2 dp ndls then they are joined between cast on spacing stitches and the hat is completed in the round earflaps make 2 same for all sizes using dp ndls co 3 sts row 1 and all right side row k1 mk1r k to last st mk1l k1 row 2 and all wrong side row k1 p to last st k1 repeat row 1 & 2 until you have a total of 17 sts wk even until 17 row have been completed end having completed a right side row make 2nd earflap exactly like first forehead to crown with 16 /41cm circular ndl co 10 13 16 18 20 sts for back place 17 sts of 1st earflap on ndl right side facing you co 20 23 27 28 30 sts for front place 17 sts of 2nd earflap on ndl as for 1st 64 70 77 80 84 sts total place a marker here to mark the beginning of each new round now k 5 -10 75cm to top of crown even yes human ears are closer together in back than in front… crown to tip crown shaping set-up round k 6 8 9 8 10 k 2 decrease place marker repeat bracketed instructions to end of round now k 1 round even now work crown shaping decrease rounds as follows k to 2 sts before marker k 2 decrease slip marker repeat bracketed instructions to end of round k 1 round even repeat the above 2 rounds as described in shaded box 1 decrease round followed by 1 k even round until only 8 7 7 8 7 sts total remain you will need to switch to dp ndls as the hat narrows & remove the markers on your final round break off yarn leaving a tail about 6 long or longer if you want a braid and tassel now draw yarn through remaining sts and draw up tightly fasten yarn end securely on inside of hat if you don t intend to do a braid and tassel edging from right side with main color single_crochet evenly around
